rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain, which must be TE.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.ETCD

datasetVariables.description: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.
datasetVariables.label: Element Code
datasetVariables.name: ETCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.ELEMENT

datasetVariables.description: The name of the Element.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Element
datasetVariables.name: ELEMENT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.TESTRL

datasetVariables.description: Expresses rule for beginning the Element.
datasetVariables.label: Rule for Start of Element
datasetVariables.name: TESTRL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.TEENRL

datasetVariables.description: Expresses rule for ending the Element. Either TEENRL or TEDUR must be present for each Element.
datasetVariables.label: Rule for End of Element
datasetVariables.name: TEENRL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.TEDUR

datasetVariables.description: Planned Duration of Element in ISO 8601 format. Used when the rule for ending the Element is applied after a fixed duration.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Duration of Element
datasetVariables.name: TEDUR

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains the element code that is unique for each element, the element description, and the rules for starting and ending an element. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49619, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Trial Elements
datasets.name: TE

datasets.datasetStructure: One Record per Planned Element per Arm

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain, which must be TA.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.ARMCD

datasetVariables.description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ARMCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.ARM

datasetVariables.description: Name given to Arm or treatment group.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariables.name: ARM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.TAETORD

datasetVariables.description: Number that gives the order of the Element within the Arm.
datasetVariables.label: Order of Element within Arm
datasetVariables.name: TAETORD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.ETCD

datasetVariables.description: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.
datasetVariables.label: Element Code
datasetVariables.name: ETCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.ELEMENT

datasetVariables.description: The name of the Element.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Element
datasetVariables.name: ELEMENT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.TABRANCH

datasetVariables.description: Condition subjects meet, at a "branch" in the Trial Design at the end of this Element, to be included in this Arm. Example: Randomization to DRUG X.
datasetVariables.label: Branch
datasetVariables.name: TABRANCH

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.TATRANS

datasetVariables.description: If the trial design allows a subject to transition to an Element other than the next Element in sequence, then the conditions for transitioning to those other Elements, and the alternative Element sequences, are specified in this rule (e.g., Responders go to washout).
datasetVariables.label: Transition Rule
datasetVariables.name: TATRANS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.EPOCH

datasetVariables.description: Name of the Trial Epoch with which this Element of the Arm is associated.
datasetVariables.label: Epoch
datasetVariables.name: EPOCH

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains each planned arm in the trial. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49618, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Trial Arms
datasets.name: TA

datasets.datasetStructure: One Record per Planned Trial Visit

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain, which must be TV.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, can be used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: Protocol-defined description of the clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY as a text description of the clinical encounter.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Due to its sequential nature, can be used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.ARMCD

datasetVariables.description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. If the timing of visits for a trial does not depend on which ARM a subject is in, then ARMCD should be null.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ARMCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.ARM

datasetVariables.description: Name given to Arm or treatment group.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariables.name: ARM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.TVSTRL

datasetVariables.description: Rule describing when the visit starts, in relation to the sequence of Elements.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Start Rule
datasetVariables.name: TVSTRL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.TVENRL

datasetVariables.description: Rule describing when the visit ends, in relation to the sequence of Elements.
datasetVariables.label: Visit End Rule
datasetVariables.name: TVENRL

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains the planned order and number of visits in the study within each arm. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49621, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Trial Visits
datasets.name: TV

datasets.datasetStructure: One Record per Trial Inclusion or Exclusion Criterion

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain, which must be TI.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.IETESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name IETEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in IETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). IETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. The name "IE" prefix is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain
datasetVariables.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Short Name
datasetVariables.name: IETESTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.IETEST

datasetVariables.description: Full text of the inclusion or exclusion criterion. The prefix "IE" is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain.
datasetVariables.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion
datasetVariables.name: IETEST

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.IECAT

datasetVariables.description: Used for categorization of the Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion: INCLUSION, EXCLUSION.
datasetVariables.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Category
datasetVariables.name: IECAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.IESCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of the exception criterion. Can be used to distinguish criteria for a sub-study or for to categorize as a major or minor exceptions. Examples: MAJOR, MINOR.
datasetVariables.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Subcategory
datasetVariables.name: IESCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.TIRL

datasetVariables.description: Rule that expresses the inclusion/exclusion criterion.
datasetVariables.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Rule
datasetVariables.name: TIRL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.TIVERS

datasetVariables.description: The number of this version of the Inclusion/Exclusion criteria. May be omitted if there is only one version.
datasetVariables.label: Protocol Criteria Versions
datasetVariables.name: TIVERS

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains one record for each of the inclusion and exclusion criteria for the trial. This domain is not subject oriented. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49620, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Trial Inclusion/Exclusion
datasets.name: TI

datasets.datasetStructure: One Record per Trial Summary Parameter

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain, which must be TS.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness within the dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: TSSEQ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a group of related records.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: TSGRPID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSPARMCD

datasetVariables.description: TSPARMCD (the companion to TSPARM) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that TSPARMCD will need to serve as variable names. Examples: AGEMIN, AGEMAX
datasetVariables.label: Trial Summary Parameter Short Name
datasetVariables.name: TSPARMCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSPARM

datasetVariables.description: Term for the Trial Summary Parameter. The value in TSPARM cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples Planned Minimum Age of Subjects, Planned Maximum Age of Subjects
datasetVariables.label: Trial Summary Parameter
datasetVariables.name: TSPARM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSVAL

datasetVariables.description: Value of TSPARM. Example: "ASTHMA" when TSPARM value is "Trial Indications". TSVAL cannot be null; a value is required for the record to be valid. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns TSVAL1-TSVALn.
datasetVariables.label: Parameter Value
datasetVariables.name: TSVAL

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains one record for each trial summary characteristic. This domain is not subject oriented. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C53483, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Trial Summary
datasets.name: TS

description: This SDTM class describes the plan for the procedures to be followed in a clinical trial, including planned and actual timing of events, control group, method of allocating treatments, blinding methods, assignment of epochs that subjects pass through in the course of a trial. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103379, 2018-06-29)
label: Trial Design Model
name: Trial Design
